content.text: If you're keen on pursuing a career in the Civil Service, then the Office for Product Safety and Standards (OPSS) is a great place to kick off your journey. In this blog post, we'll delve into some of the different career options that OPSS offers and give you the insight on what you need to know to start pursuing a role in OPSS.
OPSS are the UK government agency responsible for ensuring that the products we use are safe for us. From electronics to kids' toys, cosmetics and everything in between.
OPSS is a great place to start your career, with a range of career paths available depending on your interests and skills.
Here are some of our roles:

Product Safety Officer: This role involves assessing the safety of different products and ensuring that they adhere to regulations. You'll also be involved in investigating product safety incidents and collaborating with manufacturers to improve product safety.

Technical Specialist: If you have expertise in a particular product type, such as electronics or toys, then this could be the role for you. You'll provide guidance to product safety officers and assist in developing new safety standards.

Compliance Officer: This role entails ensuring that businesses comply with safety regulations and standards. You'll be required to carry out audits and inspections to ensure that companies are following the rules.

Policy Advisor: This role involves developing and reviewing policies that relate to product safety and standards. You'll work with government officials and industry stakeholders to ensure that regulations are up-to-date and effective.

Analysis: This role provides engineering, technology and scientific evidence and advice to underpin policy and enforcement, whilst also providing analytical support across OPSS. You’ll play a huge role in protecting consumers and the public.

To work at OPSS, we welcome a variety of skills, experience and qualifications. It's also essential to be able to work both independently and as part of a team and with excellent communication skills.
Overall, a career in OPSS is highly rewarding as you'll be working towards safeguarding consumers and ensuring the safety of products.
